list_definition.definition: to play (a football match etc) again (eg because neither team won)

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The match ended in a draw – it will have to be replayed.

list_ex_of_english: There could be no question of the local government reorganisation element standing; in such circumstances, the whole thing should be replayed.
Five matches were drawn, with replays taking place in the following midweek fixture.
Messages should not be duplicated, reordered or replayed.
Further, many words and conversations had to be replayed several times before any understanding was achieved.
Therefore, whether someone tells an event in the language in which the event originally occurred does not appear to affect how extensively the event is replayed in either language.
Having been so produced, this recorder enables records to be replayed by the use of the same device through an ordinary television set.
Material from long-term memory is revived into working memory, where it is replayed and reexperienced.
To summarize, the two basic questions (selectivity for threatening experiences, benefit of replaying these experiences in dreams) are in my view not supported by the presented evidence.
